tool_description: Creates conditional logic, skip patterns, and branching rules for surveys to customize the respondent experience based on previous answers.

survey_id.description: Target survey identifier for logic application

logic_type.description: Type of logic: skip_logic, display_logic, branching, piping, validation, or termination

trigger_question_id.description: Question that triggers the logic condition

trigger_condition.description: Condition that must be met (equals, not_equals, greater_than, less_than, contains, in_range)

target_question_ids.description: Questions affected by this logic rule

action.description: Action to take when condition is met: show, hide, skip_to, require, unrequire, or terminate

logic_priority.description: Execution priority for overlapping logic rules (1-100)

error_message.description: Custom error message for validation logic

error_messages: Invalid logic type: Must be one of [skip_logic, display_logic, branching, piping, validation, termination]
Invalid trigger condition: Must be one of [equals, not_equals, greater_than, less_than, contains, in_range]
Invalid action: Must be one of [show, hide, skip_to, require, unrequire, terminate]
Question not found: trigger_question_id or target_question_ids contain invalid question references
Priority out of range: logic_priority must be between 1 and 100
Circular logic detected: Logic rules create circular dependencies between questions
Empty target list: target_question_ids array cannot be empty
usage: Specify survey_id, logic_type, trigger details (question_id, condition, value), target_question_ids, and action. Optionally set logic_priority and error_message. Creates conditional behavior based on respondent answers.

logic_rule_id.description: Unique identifier for the created logic rule

rule_summary.description: Human-readable summary of the logic rule

affected_questions.description: Number of questions affected by this rule
